query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Era lo loco ov’ a scender la riva 2 venimmo, alpestro e, per quel che v’er’ anco, 3 tal, ch’ogne vista ne sarebbe schiva.
query.result:
**English:**
1 The place where we were to descend to the shore 2 we reached, rugged and, because of what was there also, 3 such that every sight would shun it.
**Cornish:**
1 An le a wra'n ni dhe'th dismonsya an glann, 2 ni a dheuth, alpestro ha, rag an peth a wra eno, 3 kepar, pub traweyth a wra'n ow tynhe orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Qual è quella ruina che nel fianco 5 di qua da Trento l’Adice percosse, 6 o per tremoto o per sostegno manco,
7 che da cima del monte, onde si mosse, 8 al piano è sì la roccia discoscesa, 9 ch’alcuna via darebbe a chi sù fosse:
10 cotal di quel burrato era la scesa; 11 e ’n su la punta de la rotta lacca 12 l’infamïa di Creti era distesa
13 che fu concetta ne la falsa vacca; 14 e quando vide noi, sé stesso morse, 15 sì come quei cui l’ira dentro fiacca.
query.result:
**English:**
4 Such is that landslip which on this side of Trent 5 struck the Adige on the flank, 6 either through an earthquake or through a failing support,
7 that from the top of the mountain, whence it moved, 8 the rock has fallen so far down to the plain 9 that it would afford some path to one who was above:
10 such was the descent of that ravine; 11 and on the summit of the broken cliff 12 the infamy of Crete was stretched out,
13 who was conceived in the false cow; 14 and when he saw us, he bit himself, 15 like one whose anger racks him within.
**Cornish:**
4 Kepar hy an ruina na yn flanken 5 a-dhiworth a Trento an Adice a daras, 6 po dhe'n darava po dhe'n sosten mank,
7 a-dhiworth an benn an menydh, le mayth ev mosas, 8 orth an plan an garrek a wra keswla, 9 kepar via a wra'n ow ros dhe'n neb a wra orth:
10 kepar hy an dismons a'n burrato; 11 ha war-barth an penn an rotta lacca 12 an infamia a Greti a wra istynnys,
13 neb a veu genys yn an voel fals; 14 ha pan welas ni, ev a daras y honan, 15 kepar neb a wra'y wragh a-dhiworth ow fiakka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Lo savio mio inver’ lui gridò: «Forse 17 tu credi che qui sia ’l duca d’Atene, 18 che sù nel mondo la morte ti porse?
19 Pàrtiti, bestia, ché questi non vene 20 ammaestrato da la tua sorella, 21 ma vassi per veder le vostre pene».
query.result:
**English:**
16 My wise guide shouted at him: “Perhaps 17 you think that the Duke of Athens is here, 18 who brought you death up in the world?
19 Depart, beast, for this man does not come 20 taught by your sister, 21 but he goes to see your punishments”.
**Cornish:**
16 An savio myw inver’ dhe'n gridò: “Forse 17 ty credi dhe'n sia ’l duca d’Atene, 18 dhe'n si nel mondo an marow ty porse?
19 Pàrtiti, bestia, ché questi non vene 20 ammaestrato da la tua sorella, 21 mes vassi rag gwelas le vostre pene”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Qual è quel toro che si slaccia in quella 23 c’ha ricevuto già ’l colpo mortale, 24 che gir non sa, ma qua e là saltella,
25 vid’ io lo Minotauro far cotale; 26 e quello accorto gridò: «Corri al varco; 27 mentre ch’e’ ’nfuria, è buon che tu ti cale».
query.result:
**English:**
22 What is that bull that breaks loose in that place 23 that has already received the mortal blow, 24 that does not know how to turn, but leaps here and there,
25 I saw the Minotaur do the same; 26 and that astute one shouted: "Run to the passage; 27 while he is raging, it is good that you descend."
**Cornish:**
22 Pyth yw an tarow henna a wra dhesemma 23 a gemeras an colp marow, 24 na wodho pyth oberi, mes yma ha’n allá a wra salti,
25 gweles vy an Minotauro ow kul an keth, 26 ha henna golonsek a leveris: “Red dhe’n fordh; 27 pendra ytho ef a wra yn furya, yw da dhis diskenna.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Così prendemmo via giù per lo scarco 29 di quelle pietre, che spesso moviensi 30 sotto i miei piedi per lo novo carco.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Thus we took our way down through the scarcity 29 of those stones, which often moved 30 beneath my feet because of the new burden.
**Cornish:**
28 Vel henna ny nensa niver a-woles 29 an mein a-mena, a wra movya 30 a-woles ow karrek, rag an karga nowydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Io gia pensando; e quei disse: «Tu pensi 32 forse a questa ruina, ch’è guardata 33 da quell’ ira bestial ch’i’ ora spensi.
query.result:
**English:**
31 I was already thinking; and he said: "You are perhaps thinking 32 about this ruin, which is watched over 33 by that bestial wrath which I just extinguished.
**Cornish:**
31 O wrug genef vy; ha henna a leveris: 32 "Mar pleg vy'th onan ruwynn ma, 33 a wra gwylys gans an lowenner bestyel, 34 nebma hwrug vy'n difetha."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Or vo’ che sappi che l’altra fïata 35 ch’i’ discesi qua giù nel basso inferno, 36 questa roccia non era ancor cascata.
query.result:
**English:**
34 Now I want you to know that the other time 35 that I descended down here into the lowest hell, 36 this rock had not yet fallen.**Cornish:**
34 Wrugofynnafowposowethanpenfydh 35 panwyskynnysynnaghynnyn, 36 anmenmaenma na vednkoedhwedhkyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Ma certo poco pria, se ben discerno, 38 che venisse colui che la gran preda 39 levò a Dite del cerchio superno,
40 da tutte parti l’alta valle feda 41 tremò sì, ch’i’ pensai che l’universo 42 sentisse amor, per lo qual è chi creda
43 più volte il mondo in caòsso converso; 44 e in quel punto questa vecchia roccia, 45 qui e altrove, tal fece riverso.
query.result:
**English:**
37 But surely a little while before, if I discern well, 38 he came who took from Dis the great prey 39 of the circle above,
40 on all sides the deep, foul valley 41 trembled so that I thought the universe 42 felt love, for which some believe
43 the world has often been turned to chaos; 44 and at that moment this ancient rock, 45 here and elsewhere, made such a somersault.
**Cornish:**
37 Mes sur, bythkott, ragvesa'm gwella, 38 ev a dheuth an hini a dhur an brassa preda 39 dhe Dite a'n cylgh uhella,
40 a-dro dhe bub tu, an dhywnder uhella 41 a dharava, bythkott ev a greysyn ev an bys 42 a dheuthsa karanteth, rag a grys ev nebes
43 an bys dhe vos troys ha troys dhe janjya; 44 ha'n an poynt na, an garrek koth ma, 45 ama ha'n leow, a wrug anvel orth yma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Ma ficca li occhi a valle, ché s’approccia 47 la riviera del sangue in la qual bolle 48 qual che per vïolenza in altrui noccia».
query.result:
**English:**
46 But fix your eyes on the valley, for the river of blood is approaching, 47 in which boils whoever harms others with violence.
**Cornish:**
46 Mes set dha lyga dhe'n dhywnder, rag yma'n nessa 47 an avon a woos yn aga yma'n bryjya 48 neb a wra dhe dhruthyl orth neb aral».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Oh cieca cupidigia e ira folle, 50 che sì ci sproni ne la vita corta, 51 e ne l’etterna poi sì mal c’immolle!
52 Io vidi un’ampia fossa in arco torta, 53 come quella che tutto ’l piano abbraccia, 54 secondo ch’avea detto la mia scorta;
55 e tra ’l piè de la ripa ed essa, in traccia 56 corrien centauri, armati di saette, 57 come solien nel mondo andare a caccia.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Oh blind cupidity and mad wrath, 50 that so spur us on in the short life, 51 and then so badly immerse us in the eternal one!
52 I saw a wide moat curved like a bow, 53 like that which embraces the entire plain, 54 according to what my guide had said;
55 and between the foot of the bank and it, in a line, 56 centaurs ran, armed with arrows, 57 as they used to go hunting in the world.
**Cornish:**
49 Oh, dalluster dall ha folleth, 50 a'n spron yn skon yn aga byw vyghan, 51 ha'n aga byw byth byth, skon ha folleth!
52 Yma'm gweles foss bras yn kromma orth yma, 53 kepar ha'n hini a wra'n golghi an plan oll, 54 kepar ha'n o lavaras vy skorr;
55 ha ynter troos an dowr ha'n aga, yn lin, 56 o resek centaurs, armet gans saethow, 57 kepar ha'n o szokk yn an bys dhe nessa.

**English:**
58 Seeing us descend, each one stopped, 59 and three of the troop departed, 60 with bows and arrows chosen beforehand;
61 and one of them shouted from afar: "To what torment 62 are you coming, you who descend the slope? 63 Tell us from there; if not, I draw the bow."
**Cornish:**
58 Yn gweles ni ow kodha, pub onan a sevas, 59 ha tre a'n skorr a dhrehedhas 60 gans boghow ha saethow etholys kyns.
61 Ha'n onan a lef a bell: "Dhe'n poen poen poen 62 ow tosowghwi ow kodha an garrek? 63 Leverel dhyworth ena; mar nag, yv a wra'n an bogha."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Lo mio maestro disse: «La risposta 65 farem noi a Chirón costà di presso: 66 mal fu la voglia tua sempre sì tosta».
query.result:
**English:**
64 My master said: "We will give the answer 65 to Chiron over there, nearby: 66 your desire was always too hasty."
**Cornish:**
64 Vy mestri a leveris: "An dassergh 65 a wra ni dhe Chirón ena dhe-ves: 66 drwg o an dhesyr dha bys vyth dhe boes."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Poi mi tentò, e disse: «Quelli è Nesso, 68 che morì per la bella Deianira, 69 e fé di sé la vendetta elli stesso.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Then he pointed him out to me and said: "That is Nessus, 68 who died for the beautiful Deianira, 69 and took vengeance on himself for it.
**Cornish:**
67 Wosa henna, ev a leveris: "Henna yw Nesso, 68 a verwis rag an Deianira brassa, 69 ha gwruthyl orth y honan an venjans."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 E quel di mezzo, ch’al petto si mira, 71 è il gran Chirón, il qual nodrì Achille; 72 quell’ altro è Folo, che fu sì pien d’ira.
query.result:
**English:**
70 And the one in the middle, who looks at his chest, 71 is the great Chiron, who nursed Achilles; 72 the other one is Pholus, who was so full of wrath.
**Cornish:**
70 Ha'n hini yn kres, ow sywla orth y vronn, 71 yw an Chirón bras, a vagas Achilles; 72 an hini aral yw Folo, o oas leun a wroth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Dintorno al fosso vanno a mille a mille, 74 saettando qual anima si svelle 75 del sangue più che sua colpa sortille».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Around the moat they go by thousands, 74 shooting every soul that swells 75 with blood more than their fault allotted them.
**Cornish:**
73 A-dro dhe'n foss yma'n mos dhe vilyow, 74 ow setha pub eneval a wra'n gorrys 75 gans woos moy es y golledh aga kamm."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Noi ci appressammo a quelle fiere isnelle: 77 Chirón prese uno strale, e con la cocca 78 fece la barba in dietro a le mascelle.
query.result:
**English:**
76 We approached those swift beasts: 77 Chiron took an arrow, and with the notch 78 he pulled the beard back from his jaws.
**Cornish:**
76 Ni a nessa dhe'n bests prys ma, 77 Chirón a gemeras saeth, ha gans an not 78 ev a wrug y varv dhe-ves dhe'n jaghow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Quando s’ebbe scoperta la gran bocca, 80 disse a’ compagni: «Siete voi accorti 81 che quel di retro move ciò ch’el tocca?
82 Così non soglion far li piè d’i morti».
query.result:
**English:**
79 When he had uncovered his great mouth, 80 he said to his companions: "Have you noticed 81 that the one behind moves what he touches?
82 The feet of the dead do not usually do that."
**Cornish:**
79 Pan wrug ev diskudha y vras jago, 80 ev a leveris dhe'y gompagnons: "Ow tosowghwi 81 henna onan a-ves ow mova an peth a wra'n tocha?
82 An troos a'n merow na wra'n gwruthyl kepar henna."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
83 E ’l mio buon duca, che già li er’ al petto, 84 dove le due nature son consorti,
85 rispuose: «Ben è vivo, e sì soletto 86 mostrar li mi convien la valle buia; 87 necessità ’l ci ’nduce, e non diletto.
query.result:
**English:**
83 And my good leader, who was already at his chest, 84 where the two natures are joined,
85 replied: "He is indeed alive, and I must show him 86 the dark valley all alone; 87 necessity drives us there, not pleasure.
**Cornish:**
83 Ha'gas ow da bara, neb o a veu dhe'n brest, 84 le mayth an dhew natur a veu kesunys,
85 a leveris: "Ev a veu byw, ha henna solet 86 a wra dhe'n dhal vedna; 87 an angen a wra'n dryg, na'n pleser.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Tal si partì da cantare alleluia 89 che mi commise quest’ officio novo: 90 non è ladron, né io anima fuia.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Thus he departed from singing alleluia, 89 entrusting me with this new task: 90 he is no thief, nor am I a runaway soul.
**Cornish:**
88 Henna modh ev a dhrehedh a gana alleluia 89 ow a ro's an ober nowydh-ma: 90 nyns yw ledher, na vy nyns yw eneval fuia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ma per quella virtù per cu’ io movo 92 li passi miei per sì selvaggia strada, 93 danne un de’ tuoi, a cui noi siamo a provo,
94 e che ne mostri là dove si guada, 95 e che porti costui in su la groppa, 96 ché non è spirto che per l’aere vada».
query.result:
**English:**
91 But by that power by which I move 92 my steps through this savage road, 93 grant us one of yours, to whom we are equal,
94 and who may show us where the ford is, 95 and who may carry this man on his back, 96 for he is not a spirit who can travel through the air."
**Cornish:**
91 Mes rag an nerth rag an vy'm a remov 92 ow passow vy dhe'n fordh magh selvadh, 93 ro'dhyn unn a'gas, dhe'n vy yw par,
94 ha'gas a wra'n dyskwedhes le mayth an fordh, 95 ha'gas a wra'n gorra an mab-ma dhe'n y grop, 96 rag nyns yw spyrys a yll mosya dhe'n ayr."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Chirón si volse in su la destra poppa, 98 e disse a Nesso: «Torna, e sì li guida, 99 e fa cansar s’altra schiera v’intoppa».
query.result:
**English:**
97 Chiron turned to his right haunch, 98 and said to Nessus: "Go back, and guide them, 99 and make any other band you meet turn aside."
**Cornish:**
97 Chyron a dro's dhe'n y dhreys dheho, 98 ha leveris dhe Nesso: "Drehedh, ha gorra, 99 ha wra cansya pub schiera arall a wra'n keffrys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Or ci movemmo con la scorta fida 101 lungo la proda del bollor vermiglio, 102 dove i bolliti facieno alte strida.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Now we moved on with our faithful escort 101 along the bank of the boiling crimson, 102 where the boiled ones raised their loud cries.
**Cornish:**
100 Nynso movya gans an scorta fydh 101 a-hedh an fordh a'n boylor rudh, 102 le mayth an boylys a wra'n gweles stridov uhel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Io vidi gente sotto infino al ciglio; 104 e ’l gran centauro disse: «E’ son tiranni 105 che dier nel sangue e ne l’aver di piglio.
query.result:
**English:**
103 I saw people submerged up to their eyebrows; 104 and the great centaur said: "These are tyrants 105 who laid violent hands on blood and wealth.
**Cornish:**
103 Vy a welas pobel danvena dhe'n cigel; 104 ha'n centaur meur a leveris: "E' son tirannysi 105 a ro's an gwydh ha'n aver dhe bygel."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Quivi si piangon li spietati danni; 107 quivi è Alessandro, e Dïonisio fero 108 che fé Cicilia aver dolorosi anni.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Here the pitiless injuries are bewailed; 107 here is Alexander, and the fierce Dionysius 108 who made Sicily suffer sorrowful years.
**Cornish:**
106 Ama yma an spietys danni a veu bewys; 107 ama yma yw Alcksander, ha Dionysios garow 108 a wrug Sicili golonsi blydhynyow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 E quella fronte c’ha ’l pel così nero, 110 è Azzolino; e quell’ altro ch’è biondo, 111 è Opizzo da Esti, il qual per vero
112 fu spento dal figliastro sù nel mondo».
query.result:
**English:**
109 And that brow with hair so black, 110 is Ezzelino; and that other one who is blond, 111 is Obizzo da Esti, who in truth
112 was killed by his stepson up in the world."
**Cornish:**
109 Ha henna front a'n pew an blew henna du, 110 yw Ezzelino; ha henna arall a veu blond, 111 yw Opizzo da Esti, neb rag gwir
112 veu laddys gans y vab-kamm dhe'n bys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
113 Allor mi volsi al poeta, e quei disse: 114 «Questi ti sia or primo, e io secondo».
115 Poco più oltre il centauro s’affisse 116 sovr’ una gente che ’nfino a la gola 117 parea che di quel bulicame uscisse.
query.result:
**English:**
113 Then I turned to the poet, and he said: 114 "Let this one be first for you, and I will be second."
115 A little further on, the centaur stopped 116 over a people who seemed to be up to their throats 117 emerging from that boiling mass.
**Cornish:**
113 Anedhra vy a dro's dhe'n bardh, ha henna a leveris: 114 "Henna a vi dhe'n kynsa, ha vy dhe'n nessa."
115 Bytteg moy es an centaur a omsettis 116 war-lergh pobel a veu bytteg dhe'n golon 117 a veu parys ow tos dhyworth an boylama wra'n omsettis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Mostrocci un’ombra da l’un canto sola, 119 dicendo: «Colui fesse in grembo a Dio 120 lo cor che ’n su Tamisi ancor si cola».
query.result:
**English:**
118 He showed us a shade alone on one side, 119 saying: "That one pierced the heart in God's lap 120 that still drips blood over the Thames."
**Cornish:**
118 Ytho'n dyskwedhes unn omber a-ugh dhe'n unn tu, 119 ow leverel: "Colui a wrug yn gremb dhe Dhew 120 an colon a veu dhe'n Tamis bytteg ow cola."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Poi vidi gente che di fuor del rio 122 tenean la testa e ancor tutto ’l casso; 123 e di costoro assai riconobb’ io.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Then I saw people who, outside of the river, 122 held their heads and all of their necks; 123 and of these I recognized many.
**Cornish:**
121 Wosa henna gweles pobel a-ves an avon, 122 ow tenea aga fenow ha aga kolonnek; 123 ha a-mes o henna yma a-vri owth konvedhes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Così a più a più si facea basso 125 quel sangue, sì che cocea pur li piedi; 126 e quindi fu del fosso il nostro passo.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Thus little by little the blood grew shallower, 125 so that it only boiled our feet; 126 and there our passage was over the ditch.
**Cornish:**
124 Velhevel o wrug an gwydh a-dhalleth, 125 byttegyns o a-wrussa owth traes, 126 ha ena o an pass owth an foss.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 «Sì come tu da questa parte vedi 128 lo bulicame che sempre si scema», 129 disse ’l centauro, «voglio che tu credi
130 che da quest’ altra a più a più giù prema 131 lo fondo suo, infin ch’el si raggiunge 132 ove la tirannia convien che gema.
query.result:
**English:**
127 “Just as you see on this side 128 the seething that always diminishes,” 129 said the centaur, “I want you to believe
130 that on the other side, lower and lower, 131 its bottom presses down, until it reaches 132 where tyranny must groan.
**Cornish:**
127 “Dell yw gweles war an tu bys ma 128 an dowr-wrussa a-wrug byth a-dhalleth,” 129 a leveris an centaur, “mynn a vynnaf bos kres
130 war an tu arall ma, issella ha issella, 131 yma’n dowr-wrussa a-wrug a-waska, 132 bys dhe’n tirannieth a wra dhe woska.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 La divina giustizia di qua punge 134 quell’ Attila che fu flagello in terra, 135 e Pirro e Sesto; e in etterno munge
136 le lagrime, che col bollor diserra, 137 a Rinier da Corneto, a Rinier Pazzo, 138 che fecero a le strade tanta guerra».
query.result:
**English:**
133 Divine justice goads here 134 that Attila who was a scourge on earth, 135 and Pyrrhus and Sextus; and eternally milks
136 the tears, which it squeezes out with the heat, 137 from Rinier da Corneto, from Rinier Pazzo, 138 who made such war on the roads.
**Cornish:**
133 An gwirvos justith a-wrug yma a-boen 134 an Attila na veu flagel war an nor, 135 ha Pyrrhus ha Sextus; ha byth a-wrug a-wella
136 an dewdh, a-wrug a-wella gans an gwres, 137 dhyworth Rinier da Corneto, dhyworth Rinier Pazzo, 138 a wrug kemmysk bell dhyworth an fordhow.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Poi si rivolse e ripassossi ’l guazzo.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Then he turned and recrossed the ford.
**Cornish:**
139 Wosa henna a droas ha a-hedhas an dowr-wrussa.
